author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Mexican tourists mistakenly killed by Egyptian security forces - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Mexican tourists mistakenly killed by Egyptian security forces Published on : Monday, September 14, 2015
Mexican tourists taking a trip in the desert terrain of Egypt were mistakenly killed by security forces in Egypt during an anti- terror operation. The tourists were travelling in four vehicles that had entered a restricted zone in the Wahat area of the western desert.
12 people were killed in all. Ten Mexican and Egyptian tourists were also injured and were taken to the local hospital.
An investigative team has been formed to look into what exactly happened. The incident was condemned by the Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto.
At least two Mexican nationals were killed and the identities of the other victims have not been confirmed. The Mexican tourists who were injured are in a stable condition.
Since the tourists were travelling in a military zone which is off limits for foreigners it was natural that the military forces took such a drastic step. The vast desert area is attractive to foreign sightseers but the area is also frequented by terrorist groups so the military mistakenly took such a drastic step said the Egyptian Ministry.
With terrorist activity on the rise the region is a gateway to the long border with Libya as weapons are available on the other side.
